column4: Can anyone help me? I am logged in as root@(none) and need to change my passwd
If you are as root you can use "su username" to access your accound then "passwd newpassword"
Probably that is just the name of the X extension. Many drivers don't support DRI (it's maily Free ones that do support it)
That would kind of defeat the point :)
I am confudes :(
You on Nvidia?
Free ATI drivers support DRI (on Radeon 9200 and below). I think FGLRX supports it too, but I'm not sure
:( I have a mobility 9700
It is loading the driver
in this case: radeon?
it is supposed to load "ati" not "radeon"
The radeon driver doesn't have 3D on your card (I think)
ATI is a Free 2D driver, radeon is a 3D (usually) Free driver and fglrx is a 3D non-Free driver
but in xorg.conf I set it to use ati not radeon, why would it load radeon?
How do I check the driver being useed?
No idea sorry (I've only been using an ATI for a few weeks)
386 is an ancient model of PC processor
ATI and Radeon drivers WILL NOT give DRI on your card. Fglrx may
Close any synaptic/update manager/aptitude/whatever else uses apt and try again
same thing
What is this DbDriver? This came up after removing libperl-qt which gave me another error. >_<!
